Review.Titre: Your subscription model will kill your business
Review.Contenu: I have a couple of Cardo Edges that my wife and I use, and have been recommending them to friends everywhere, as I believe they have been the best value.I believe this is no longer true because Cardo is going to a subscription model for their Custom series. The idea is you buy a basic unit to get into the ecosystem inexpensively, then upgrade it later. This does not sound like a bad idea, if it was a one-time fee, but my understanding is that it is NOT. It is a subscription, meaning that for as long as you want the extra features, you will pay FOREVER to have them. You could end up paying several times more than a top of the line unit would have cost. I'm sure that's great for Cardo's bottom line, but it takes advantage of folks who have less money, eventually charging them many times what a better unit (with all features enabled always) would have cost. Why not just charge for the difference, plus a small enabling fee, as a one-time charge? Cardo would still make more money than they would have had the customer originally bought the pricier model, and you'd have much happier customers.If you continue this subscription model, I fear you'll find a way to expand that to the rest of your lineup, so that people are no longer purchasing your product, but merely renting it. I'll quit on you long before you get to that point.

Review.Titre: Unfortunate product default; not taken seriously
Review.Contenu: I bought a Cardo Packtalk Slim JBL duo package in December 2020. February 2023 (hence, 2 years and roughly 3 months later) my Packtalk stopped working. It was unable to charge, gave weird responses to the buttons I pressed, etc. Sparing the details: It probably short circuited due to a ride in the rain. I store my Cardo Packtalk Slim on my helmet, which is placed in a closet, away from direct sunlight, dust and in a room which is always between 18 and 25 degrees Celsius. Furthermore, I close the small rubber cap when not charging, to prevent anything from entering the connector. This Cardo had been used for approximately 9.000 km's (lets say that is about 100 - 180 hours). Since I had two devices (one on the helmet of my girlfriend, but she did not ride with me as often and since I am currently driving a lot (work traffic)), I installed the second Packtalk Slim on my helmet. This packtalk slim had only been used for approximatly 25 - 40 hours. I made sure to always update both devices and keep them charged when I did not use them for a few months. However, after a rainy day driving home from work, this one also short-circuited (or something, I'm not an expert). Weird noises, seemed to have a will of its own, buttons pressed resulted in different outcomes than they are programmed for, etc. This one however did still charge. I contacted Cardo Support to address the issue with both Packtalk Slims. They seemed to take me seriously at first, but pointed me to my expired warranty shortly after (2 years and 3 months, which is 3 months too long). Ofcourse a warranty date exists for a reason. I understand that. But considering my issues, the state of the devices (still good, maintained and one almost good as new), the claim that the product should be waterproof, my suspicion of the products being damaged by the rain, and it happening with both devices in very similar fashion, I simply do not understand the way they have handled the complaint. They seem to have no interest in the product default, preventing this issue from occuring with other costumers or products in the future, etc. While they told me they "value my feedback". The only thing they did, was offer me a 28% discount code. Replacing both devices (with low confidence in the products now...) with this discount code is still way to expensive for the money I already payed and the current prices of shops near me. A lot of family and friends drive with Cardo systems and had them for more then 5 (some even 8) years and never had issues. I do not complaint about me being unlucky and having a default, things happen. I complain about the way they handle it and care about the customer and the long-term product quality. I am now using my brothers Packtalk Bold, which works perfectly, but have to return it to him soon... Summarized: Product itself: 5 stars (both Slim and Bold)Product quality: 1 star (for the Slim)Customer service: 3 stars, they respond quickly and are kind. Problem solving: 1 star Long term interest in good products: 1 star

For a year + I waited for you to start selling a separate Edge cradle so I could replace the 2nd helmet Bold cradle. I was very disappointed the Cardo did not help me with my Talkpack Bold. It stop charging properly. I tried several attempts to obtain support, but I was brushed off with a 20% coupon for legacy products. That being said I do believe Cardo does make the best communicators. The only reason I did is because they do produce the best communicators.

I had asked for the package to be left at side door, it was left on the front porch for everyone to see.Also, the installation instructions with just drawings are not easy to follow, the finishing details of it.But the product works perfectly once installed.

Review.Titre: Ordered these and 1week later there was…
Review.Contenu: Ordered these and 1week later there was a 20% discount. Customer service would honor. Said I had to return and reorder.
Order went fine. Got product ok. Never got a shipment notice or tracking or anything about my order until yesterday, more than a month after I actually received my product.

so far my experience with my packtalk edge has been fantastic the only issue is the ordering/shipping. Overall good but shipping took longer

Review.Titre: The units were not easily connectable and did not work more than 500' separatoni
Review.Contenu: The units were not easily connectable.  We were never able to get all 6 unit to connect over several days of trying.  Once connected, we found the furthest we could get was 500' before we could not hear each other. Communication of shipping could be better.  I received no shipping details for a couple of weeks and then the item arrived with no notification.  I then received shipping notification two weeks after it was delivered by Fedex.  I was concerned enough about the order that I waited on hold for nearly an hour to talk to someone about the order.

The reason for 3 stars is because the mic I received originally was broken and had to wait for a new one to ship to me. Cardo support was super fast and nice to send a new mic to me for free. Other than that I am super happy with my Cardo

I THINK after 5 days of pulling my hair out of my head, I finally got them to work… I think. Hopefully from this point on the Freecom 2x will be the greatest devices since sliced bread.

Review.Titre: Spirit system works great. Customer service not so much.
Review.Contenu: The system works great. I use it mainly for the intercom feature with my wife as she's learning how to ride her own motorcycle. It works so far exactly as advertised. Review.Titre: Ordered two usb chargers for my cardo…
Review.Contenu: Ordered two usb chargers for my cardo freedom 2x. The good thing is that you have it in stock. The bad thing it took to long for my order to be shipped. I had to send an email requesting tracking information after several days after my order was received. To this date I have not received it.

On January 19 i ordered a Spirit HD but never got a confirmation email, the next day i sent an email to customer support and they responded within 4 hours each email, not the quickest response.. the next few days we talked they took almost (if not) a full day to respond or even 2 days. Total lack of any communication. Tried to see if a new battery could be installed in my pack talk. They make a good product but customer support sucks.

I ordered these two days before Christmas and they shipped almost instantly. That part was awesome. 5 stars.  However I received no tracking number, no info on delivery. Review.Titre: The cardo edge is great so far
Review.Contenu: The cardo edge is great so far. The company isn’t. I called customer service when I first ordered and was rushed off the phone. Great service, just my jbl speakers have a odd crackle sound when I am listening to music. For 200+ dollars you'd think the speakers would be perfect.They make riding better though. Just don't like the crackle popping sound, not a good quality from jbl.

Review.Titre: It seem to take a long time for the…
Review.Contenu: It seem to take a long time for the package to get here, two weeks? Perhaps consider streamlining your shipping logistics.

The Cardo system sounds good when the bike is stopped . Both volume and bass are poor once you get riding. The sound is very ''TINNY''. Overall the sound isn't that good for the price. Not impressed at all.

I got the packtalk edge. It is my first helmet speaker/communication system. I figured I would spend the extra bucks to get the best quality I could find; however, I was disappointed. The unit works just fine, but it is way overpriced. The bass is minimal. The volume would need to be way too high to register any bass. This might be the case for all helmet systems not just cardo, but this is my first so I have no reference to compare to. I left my unit to charge over night and the port flap is now slightly bent. It wouldn’t close all the way which isn’t a problem unless it was to be used in the rain. I was able to apply heat to reshape the flap and get it closed again, but I shouldn’t need to do that. I would assume this is just be a defect of my unit.The talk quality is good! Very easy to hear people talking. The “hey cardo/siri” feature was very frustrating for me. It works perfectly when standing still but once in motion, the unit could not understand me. The mic was positioned close enough to my mouth that I could touch it if I puckered up a bit, so I think it was positioned as intended. Updating the unit was very easy and intuitive. Attaching it to the helmet was easy enough. The battery life seems to be very good. After about 2 hours of riding the unit was still essentially fully charged. Again, the units works fine for the most part, but for the price I would rather just keep using one airpod. I will be returning my unit.
I received my item and it was fast and in good condition but the sound it puts out is horrible. Volume does not get very high compared to the other one. Sound is real flat.
Shipment company was terrible. First I thought that my product was lost, then it appeared somehow.

Review.Titre: Bought two pack talk ski sets
Review.Contenu: Bought two pack talk ski sets. In less than 4 uses, about 3 weeks old one unit only stays charged about 15 to 30 minutes.  Then I find a 30 day warranty, which frankly is unacceptable for an expensive solid state electronic device. I put in for a warranty case, which is not really progressing.

Review.Titre: Used my Cardo freecom 2+ twice and the…
Review.Contenu: Used my Cardo freecom 2+ twice and the mount broke. The other one is still good. Poor quality if it breaks that soon. The inner frame for the mount peels out of the outer frame and doesn't let me secure. I'd have gone thru warranty but I'm sick of warranty issues and paperwork.

Shopping online, and navigating the website was great. I love the product too However, after I purchased there was no way (that I saw) that I could get back on the website to view my order status. Eventually I got an “it shipped” email but it would be nice  to see the status on your shopping website.

Review.Titre: Good order processing, but no speaker covers
Review.Contenu: The parts I ordered, microphone covers, were sent in a timely fashion and at a reasonable cost. However, the main wear item with Cardo helmet headsets, in my experience is not the mikes, but the speakers. I had hoped that covers for the speakers would be included with the mike covers, but they were not, and they are not even offered for sale. Not being able to buy covers for the speakers inside my helmet is a big problem to me. Mine have worn out and that means that I hear a lot more road noise than I used to, which makes it harder to hear my wife, who I'm trying to communicate with on the ride. I can't review Cardo highly until they correct this problem.

this experience was extremely frustrating. We had USB problems with a unit that was 5 months out of warranty. it was actually the third unit as it had been replaced twice for the same issue. before. Cardo offered us a discount on a new unit which would be ok if the problem was not a known issue with the charging port. The Cardo worked great until this problem kept happening

Well you sent me this survey before I even received my product. I can review processing and shipment. I give you an average score on that for free shipping. Still not sure if I will have it for the long weekend. Probably not.

I love your product. And 3 stars is pretty harsh, but the packing was terrible. It was a box in a box with NO packing. Can't do any worse than that. Hopefully my cardo is tough, but the potential damage and wear was unnecessary.

Received an email from Cardo to provide a review 4 days after I ordered the Packtalk Bold from their website.  Unfortunately it hasn't arrived yet, now 12 days after ordering, so very hard to review the product itself. I purchased a cardo packtalk bold with the upgraded JBL speakers. I have to say that they don't live up to the hype. The speakers are not very loud at all. I was expecting much louder. Another thing is the buttons on the side are not very tactile especially with gloved hands. A lot of times I have to tell the cardo device what to do two or more times before it listens to me.

I ordered and paid for 2 Packtalk Black communicators and only received 1.  I called Cardo and the person I spoke with was unable to look up my order or tell me if the second one was shipped from a different location or back ordered. Very frustrating as I ordered these for a snowmobile trip we have planned in a few days.

Review.Titre: Customer service was very very subpar
Review.Contenu: Customer service was very very subpar. As for the product itself I still haven’t received it yet. But not knowing when it was shipping out or any information after release day was not a pleasant experience.

Review.Titre: I haven’t installed it yet but so far…

Review.Contenu: The initial order that I ordered was returned to sender at the US/Canada border as there was an incorrect commercial invoice apparently, but I called support to enquire and they created a new order for me which was delivered a week later.

I like almost everything about the unit. The way it auto reconnects if you get too far away, the sound is amazing, and the battery life is astounding. My only gripe is that you can't control the music and intercom volumes independently.
So far, product has worked as advertised. I have not had a chance to try multiple user mode yet. Audio quality is excellent, very clear while wearing modular helmet.
Product showed up well packaged and in timely manner. Have not used the intercom function as of yet, but quality sound from speakers.

Review.Titre: I own a set of Cardo Edge units with 50k km+ of usage
Review.Contenu: I own a set of Cardo Edge units which together have travelled ~50k km over almost all of North America.  Snow, freezing rain, hale, thundershowers, 40+ C heat and 0 deg C cold.  These units have been bulletproof.  I'd highly recommend the Edge models for all you hard core Adv and touring riders that demand the best all weather performance.

Review.Titre: Order came fast, best system, worst client service
Review.Contenu: Order came fast, device works perfectly, best on market for sure. Customer service is bad, it just don't work, no replies at all. Good this, that I've managed to solve issue using forums, but if i needed to return my cardo, or warranty service - i really don't now how to do that with out customer service. Phone number, provided for my country (Latvia) - it's just local reseller of cardo systems, they do not provide world warranty service for item bought online.

Great tool that changes your riding experience!!Very good audio quality by JBL.Noise reduction is astonishing: you can't even ear the wind on the mike in case you ride with a jet or open modular helmet.5 stars when voice operation is not affected by engine boost.

Product order, delivery and packaging were decent.  I didn't get the free gift as promised but oh well.  After installing the unit on the helmet I discovered that it functioned as well as anticipated with telephone calls.  The volume and quality of signal from the radio for voice and music was better that Harley Davidson by a long shot but could still be louder to be able to compete with pipes at highway speeds above 70 mph.  Have not taken the unit on an extended ride so I cannot comment on the units performance over an extended period (battery life & connectivity overall).

I’ll admit it was frustrating getting my Bold to properly pair and work with my 2018 Goldwing tour(mostly the fault of the bikes pairing sequence) but have had it for over 4 years now and it works and sounds great. The mic mute update was huge and eliminated unwanted passenger noise, coughs etc. Battery life is still over 7 hrs(longer than I usually ride) so no complaints there. I will definitely go cardo when the time comes to replace these

Preface- I wear modular helmet.Cardo is a great communication tool. When I ride alone it's nice to be able to stream my music in my phone. When I ride with others it becomes much easier to organize stops, turns, passing. Initially I thought the speakers didn't go loud enough, but after moving them slightly down in my helmet, it changed the volume tremendously. I love my Cardo.

Wife & I have Been using packtalk Bold  several years. Overall happy with the system, once you get them dialed in. “Cardo Connect” instructions could be better. Batteries should be replaceable. The mini USB socket broke on my unit—need better design.

Review.Titre: Got a duo edge for full face helmets
Review.Contenu: Got a duo edge for full face helmets. Excellent for intercom, music and telephone calls. Over the air updates easy to do. Haven’t tried group rides yet. Battery life seems shorter than advertised. Voice commands work some of the time. Physical buttons hard to use- wish they had a button type remote for the handlebar. Also wish they had a setup for using the edge unit just with earphones/mic without helmet.

I have the Freecom 4x model and I really like it while commuting to work for radio and music play. The complaint I have is while in comm mode riding off-road. I hang back about 100 yards from the other riders to let the dust settle and the cardo is constantly disconnecting and connecting communication between riders. It's supposed to work for .75 miles but when we got over 100 yards or so it didn't work well. I guess the Bluetooth needs line of sight for connection and mountain dirt roads aren't exactly ideal. It works great on road since we can close the gap.

Review.Titre: Great Communication Tool for my wife and I
Review.Contenu: My wife and I have had the Cardo headset going on 10 years now. We love them. We communicate constantly as we ride together. My wife has her own bike, so I can communicate road issues and give instructions as we ride. (Switch lanes, watch for gravel, deer on the right, etc.) I will never ride without some sort of communication device with my wife. We love having these on our helmets.

Great product.  But I'm having a VERY difficult time positioning the speakers in my particular helmet.  Even if I DO eventually get them positioned properly, the biggest joy I have in riding is listening to music on my sealed ear buds.  I'm a professional musician and I love the clarity as well as the bass frequencies I get from a closed/sealed in ear bud.  I'm really surprised Cardo doesn't connect to blue tooth ear buds, since it's such a wireless based system.  I'm still experimenting, but so far I'd say going from my sealed ear buds to these separated speakers has been a serious downgrade to my riding experience.   Other than that...the rest of it works really well.

Sound quality is awesome. Bought two sets and have had difficulty paring with my wife’s; also sometimes it disconnects unexpectedly. Have only used it on 2 rides so still a steep learning curve. It’s a lot different than my older Cardo it replaced.

Review.Titre: The new hardware is pretty slick
Review.Contenu: The new hardware is pretty slick. Range seems better than the bold and I'm liking the new mounting option which seems robust and reliable. One gripe though is battery life. The unit does not seem to last as long as the bold, which could be just because of the additional features.

The device is great installation was easy. I have a modular helmet. Wish the mic cable was a bit longer to keep the wire all tucked away when wearing,  battery life is awesome. The speakers. Are a bit uncomfortable. But sound great.

Review.Titre: My PackTalk Bold functions perfectly for directions and communications
Review.Contenu: My PackTalk Bold functions perfectly for listening to directions or communicating with others when connected with either my Garmin Zumo XT and my smartphone except for one, which is why I gave it only 4 stars instead of 5: When I listen to music (mp4 files) that have been loaded onto my Garmin Zumo XT, the music cuts out frequently for a second or two. It makes listening to music really annoying. This does not happen when I use my Bluetooth ear buds for connectivity rather than my Cardo unit.

The representative assured me that the clip was included, just not the sticky mount, so I ordered...when I received it there was no clipUpdate:  the part was shipped to me... but still better transparency needs to be on the listing so people know exactly what they'll be getting

Review.Titre: Personally I feel there could be better…

Review.Titre: Great unit for the most part.…

We're hoping it continues to function because we really enjoyed using the intercoms. Six thousand miles without being able to talk to each other wouldn't have been nearly as much fun.

The biggest issue I personally is not being able to turn of the auto cell phone call answer. If you have an incoming call and dont want to answer you have to be perfectly quiet or it answers no way to turn it off. Maybe the edge doesn't do this I have not got to test it yet.

The only negative thing I can say is I never got a tracking or shipping email after I ordered my cardo. I needed to message you instagram account to get help on tracking my item, even that took a few days to respond. I think that needs to be tightened up. Other then that the actual product has been great

We no longer need to wait for each other at chairs, instead, we are able to give comments to each other while one is on the slope and the other one is on the lift. Plus, it requires no cellular or internet signal. Perfect for ski resorts.

Great service, delivery very prompt and easy website to purchase, saved around $100 plus even with exchange rate difference. Also so pleased with new product, 2nd Cardo product purchased and this one so much better. Highly recommend.

On a trip a few years ago I went through 3 competitor units that were not waterproof. Since switching to Cardo I have experienced better sound quality, better noise cancelling, better mesh capability and the true ability to ride in any weather condition without fear of losing connectivity. Truly a great product and the new update over-air instead of hooking up is amazing! The only downside is the lack of support for the Packtalk Bold now that the Edge has come out. However, it was well worth the upgrade!
Originally rated with one star b/c I have a lot of orders and mistook this for another vendor.  Good web interface, quick response and timely delivery.

Review.Titre: Good quality sound, good software support
Review.Contenu: Switched from SENA SF4 to Cardo Edge. Cardo has very good quality sound. DMC mesh is excellent. Battery capacity lasts for almost 2 days. Lots of communication, important specially in terrains like Himalayas, where overtaking of trucks is risky.

Greatest unit out there in my opinion and the customer support with a self induced issue was terrific.  Not being a technical person and not being as young as most of the riders and users the support staff identified my problem and help me through getting it back up to optimal performance.  They did not make me feel like an old fool in any way...  FANTASTIC !!!!!!!!!!

Review.Titre: Two thumbs up, an absolute MUST buy!
Review.Contenu: We have used our Cardo Packtalk devices all over the country! It’s wonderful to be able to communicate with my passenger and other bikes that come with us on our adventures. Whether it be listening to music, deciding when to take a break, or taking a phone call…our Cardo Packs are easy to use and maintain. We live in Indiana and have traveled to San Diego, New Orleans, Washington DC, and Niagara Falls to just name a few. All of our trips have been made more enjoyable with our Cardo Packs with us. I would buy them again in a second and would recommend others who plan on hitting the road to do the same!
Got my headphones in about 4 days installed them into my helmet plugged them into my Cardo packtalk edge amazing what a 5mm diff makes in a small headphone

Review.Titre: My Edge has been used for over 20K…
Review.Contenu: My Edge has been used for over 20K miles in all types of weather, 35 to 110 degrees and hours of constant rain without a single problem.  The battery will last almost 2 days of full riding, although I usually charge it each night. I usually ride alone, but when I do ride with friends the mesh connection is fast and efficient.

Have used several Cardo units over the years after having switch from the other company.  My experience has been very good with Freecom4+, Bold, and now Edge headsets.  My passenger and I are able to have intercom conversations as if we are in the car and I have been part of a 12 person ride where we were all mesh connected with no issues and a mile plus range.

I recently purchased 3 Cardo Packtalk Edge systems.  I can't say how much fun and safer it made our riding experience.  The installation on our helmets was a breeze and the connection just as easy.  We take them with us on every ride. Once we are connected all you have to do is speak and we are all part of the conversation.  Its that easy.  The battery life is great and they lasted us all weekend without a charge.  Thank you for such a great product!!

I am a Ski Instructor and have purchased 2 of the Cardo student kits.  Being able to give feedback to students while they are skiing and seeing the students take the corrective action while they are skiing is a total game changer!  I absolutely love this product and all of my students love it as well.The only negative feedback i have heard from my fellow ski instructors is the price.  With the PSIA discount, the cost for the instructor kit is $830 which is too much money for a lot of the part time instructors to pay.  I'm not sure if anything can be done, but perhaps a financing program where people could spread the payments over 24 months?

I've been a Cardo Owner since 2016 when I bought my first Smart Pac.  It served me well  In 2023, I decided to upgrade to their latest and greatest - The Packtalk Edge.  What a huge improvement.  Absolutely no wind noise.  This is impressive with the fact everyone I ride with wear 1/2 helmets.  Also the Bluetooth 5.2 connection to the phone is solid.  My only disappointment is that they changed the receiver on the helmet to the magnetic mount system.  This meant I had to buy extra helmet kits for my other helmets.

Order came in a reasonable time. The product was super simple to set up with all the manuals and videos.  Love the quality of the device and would absolutely recommend it to anyone riding.  Only wish that the voice command was more versatile and didn’t rely on very specific phrases for commands.

My experience was fantastic. My first order was lost and Cardo helped me with a second one. shipping I am grateful for the Good service, I will continue buying and recommending Cardo intercoms, which are for me the best on the market.

Review.Titre: You get exactly what you pay for.
Review.Contenu: The biggest thing for me is how seamless the connection is with other Cardo units. My only complaint with my Cardos is that I have yet to figure out how to share music with my passenger unit. They are great overall for music, coms and phone calls and wouldn't trade them for any other brand.

Review.Titre: I used to have a Sena
Review.Contenu: I used to have a Sena, this system is heads and tails above that!  The sound quality is amazing!!  You cant even turn it up all the way up!  I recommend this system to EVERYONE!!!  I am going to get my son one for Christmas as matter of fact.

Review.Titre: I have a problem with my sound
Review.Contenu: I have a problem with my sound. connection cable we try most of the things with cardo support team. at the end they send me new cradle and problem has been finished.There are some problems with new motorcycle bluetooth systems connection. before I have already gave an information. but we can not find a solution.
The web site did not list what I needed, but when I called they gave me a link to the part so I could order it; easy-peasy, quick delivery.

User of Cardo intercoms since 2012.  Owned a G9, a Packtalk Bold and currently a Packtalk Edge, so I think that no more words are necessary.Just to say something bad, always desired more communication distance ;-)
Setup and installation was easy. Unit provided me with the features that I wanted.I especially like the battery level reminder each time that the unit is powered off.
Accurate description and quick shipping.  The speakers sound great though had to take the covers off so they would still sit in the Shoei Neotech II speaker holes.

Was in a moto crash. Found the cardo seperated from helmet. I got a new helmet, installed the speakers and mic. This part allowed me to attach the unit to the helmet, and it still worked. Has full functionality, even after being in a crash.

Review.Titre: I have been using packtalk bold from…2019
Review.Contenu: I have been using packtalk bold from 2019 on a daily basis. Never had any issue and I recommend it to communicate with pillion and other riders alike. Long battery life and user friendly mobile interface.

I can not believe how game changing the CARDO system has been for myself and the team. Between the DMC mesh software and pit crew headset you can’t beat this product. Group riding is so easy now. Racing with the system changed every aspect and made it so easy!  Thank you team cardo. Remarkable product and support!  A MUST BUY!!!

First, price. Cardio’s spring promo cut 25% off the purchase price. That was better than I could find anywhere else. Shipping was fast and affordable too. Second, quality and improvement. I’ve been using a Packtalk Bold for two years and it’s proven to be a good unit. It does have occasional connectivity issues with my iPhone and with getting a group pairing set up. With the Edge that I just purchased I have not had any connectivity issues at all. Although I have not used it on a group ride yet. I am interested in seeing if improvements have been made in connectivity of the mesh over distance and terrain. Time will tell.

It's quite convenient that Cardo offers these base kits for second helmets. I had already bought a second Packtalk, one for street and one for dirt, so I could listen to music, GPS, radar detector, and monitor my phone while riding. Now I can install these base kits in my wife and daughter's helmets so they can join in at less than half the cost. My only gripes are small. You can't order them with the JBL 45mm speakers. Even though I bought directly from Cardo and created an account, I could not monitor my order. So far I am very happy with all 4 of my purchases.

We love our Cardo intercoms!  We just purchased our second set and it was an overall good experience.  We had to reach out to customer service to get the status of our purchase, but they responded quickly and professionally.

I was on a 3000 mile trip. My EDGE unit needed replacement under warranty. Within a couple of email exchanges I had a new replacement on the way to me.Very much appreciated the attention and quick response as i was leading 10 riders.

Reliability and customer service!   I'm not a complicated rider.  I typically only pair to my phone and the bike audio.  I rarely ever use the "mesh" connection...just not into the chit chat.   If I need to contact someone I make a cell call from the Cardo through my phone.I went through a series of SENA devices with so/so experience both with the equipment and customer support.  I finally bailed with the 50 series.I switched over to a Packtalk Bold and was astounded at how straightforward it was to set up and use, that is worked each time I turned it on, and how good the sound was. Over the past three years I've upgraded to the Edge and continue to be impressed.   It's "bulletproof".  connects every time, sounds great and works as expected. First rate experience

Review.Titre: Choosing between the Edge or the 50S? Easy Choice
Review.Contenu: I've owned and used motorcycle helmet mounted communicators since they first made the scene. I've had and used both the Cardo and the Sena top models  as they have evolved; presently, I have the Edge and the Sena 50S. I have used them for music, telecommunication, for GPS and radar info and for communication with other riders (and pillion).  Without question, the Edge outperforms the 50S in every respect: connectivity, ease of use, sound quality, versatility (I don't need peripheral units that I do for some functions with the Sena), reliability and customer service, to name some criteria that are important to me. I have the Sena only for when I know that I will be riding and wish to connect with others who have Sena units. When I make the switch, I can't wait to return my Edge to its place on my helmet.

I’ve been a Cardo Fan late 2011, I purchased the G4 just prior to riding from San Diego to Southern Missouri with my wife. The G4 was a game changer for us, no longer was our rider/passenger conversation initiated by a slap on my helmet, or a vague hand signal. That first 1800 mile ride with Cardo made all the difference in the world, long days on the road, were made more enjoyable, listening to music, talking about the road, sharing directions, planning stops, not to mention the safety of always being informed of what the others on our road trip were doing or planning, for bathroom breaks or gas stops. My wife and I just recently returned from a 3000 mile loop from San Diego CA to Wheatland WY and back, I can’t even imagine that 10 trip without our PackTalk Bolds I have been a Cardo user of many products, I have used the G9, G9x, PackTalk, and now PactTalk Bold, each version gets better than the last! DMC was a huge upgrade for us, since I offer ride with 8-10 riders it’s made adding other riders and communicating with the group seamless. I can’t wait to get my hands on the PackTalk Edge, I know it will not disappoint.See you on the road! -George
After some disappointments with competitor products I finally purchased the PACKTALK edge for me and my wife. Now everything works as it should and we always desired. Easy and reliable - perfect.

Review.Titre: Definitely buy yourself a Cardo Packtalk
Review.Contenu: I was recommended Cardp Packtalk by a friend.Its been great!!!the unit is so easy to use, links to my friends when we got out riding together.I love that i can use it with my phone for easy sat-nav facility and always enables me to enjoy road trip tunes.and the fact i can do almost everything by voice command is great!

PROS :Easy to set up. Connects seamlessly to my Samsung A51 phone and to my Garmin Zumo XT.Connects right away with another rider that has the Cardio Black. Range is pretty good too. The voice command is spot on and works flawlessly each time I use it. The JBL speakers sound great.  CONS: The radio reception is very lacking.  Would recommend to a friend.  YES !! I like the EDGE better than the Cardio Freecom 2+ I replaced with this EDGE.

Fabulous.  Sounds great. Much better than the Sena I have in Arizona.  The speakers are awesome.  To get the best sound I went to music, then sound on my iPhone and set it in increase bass. Makes a huge difference.   I wear hearing aids and even though it’s a challenge to get my modular Abel helmet on with my glasses and hearing aids.  Once it’s in place it’s great. I also used a couple 2” round felt furniture pads to get the speakers a little closer to my ears.  Also made a big difference in the bass. Most of the time voice control works fairly well. It’s just a matter of learning the acceptable commands Cardo understands I am having trouble pairing both my phone at the same time as my tom tom gps.  Any help would be appreciated

Review.Titre: All I needed was to replace the glue…
Review.Contenu: All I needed was to replace the glue plate for the Cardo Edge and fortunately it is offered without purchasing a complete kit. Very nice and works great.

I also like that I can interface with my bike, my phone or the Packtalk directly/manually. My wife and I use it without issue on every ride. A bit on the expensive side but certainly worth it. It is a good investment that I expect will last for a long time.
Excellent product along with excellent customer support. I had an issue with one of my units. They did a total replacement free of charge. I love my Cardo Packtalk Edge!!!

Good product and fast shipping. Lots of information to read on about all models.

Review.Contenu: Quick shipping of my new Packtalk Edge, and it has performed perfectly on a recent trip with friends.
Love this Cardo. Music and podcast are no problem.  Got to mesh with other riders in Laconia. So much fun. Thanks to Ben from Bikes Beards and Brews on YouTube for the recommendation.

I've made annual trips across the US as well as five BDR rides and the Bold functioned flawlessly.  Last year, though, it finally "gave up" and wouldn't charge anymore.  I replaced it with a Packtalk Black and love it!  Cardo is the best!
Just works, easy to use, bike to bike intercom has good range, take calls, listen to music, wouldn’t be without my freecom

I bought my first Cardo long ago. It was the G4 modell. Back then it was the best, superior to everything i tried exept Gold Wings Corded intercom.Today Me and my wife ride two bikes. And we have our two boys as pillions.We upgraded to G9 and the intrecom between all 4 got better. But still when loosing connection to my wifes bike, it had a hard time reconnecting all 4 units.After uppgrading to PackTalk Bold it's work like champ.Yes we still loose connection when we drift a part to far. But as soon we are in reach again, they reconnect always.I've not been in need to use any service or support from Cardo, so I cant't say anything about that.I love our PackTalks, but not everything is great.Two major issues as I see it. The RDS Radio is crap, at least in Sweden. I listen to Spotify through my phone instead. And I might miss some valuble traffic information.And the other issue is the connections to the other major brand of intercom, Sena.And this is not Cardos problem alone, but the day when Sena and Cardo can agree on a standard the let ANY brand easily connect, that will be the day...OK, you can connect to Sena riders through bluetooth, but then you are back 10-15 years in the quality of the connection. You loose all the great feaures.

Review.Titre: I love my Cardo Pack Talk comms
Review.Contenu: I love my Cardo Pack Talk comms. They easily pair to each other, or to my devices.  The Cardo units are so easy to use and operate compared to the other brands.  Well worth the investment.
